  1. Greenest municipalities honoured

    The implementation of waste management strategy makes an emphasis on creating sustainable job opportunities. The 3rd Waste Khoro held last month also observed the need to create jobs as it was held under the theme ‘Creating jobs and increasing efficiencies in the delivery of waste services’. Since waste management is a competency of the third sphere of governance, we are already in discussion with municipalities to start changing their attitude on waste and see waste as money. Read more >>

  2. Benguela current commission in Port Elizabeth

    21 November 2012 - The Benguela Current Commission (BCC) is to hold its Projects Steering Committee and Management Board meetings in Port Elizabeth, from today, 21 November to Friday, 23 November 2012. The BCC is a multi-sectoral inter-governmental initiative of the governments of South Africa, Angola and Namibia..Read more >>

  3. Government condemns rhino killing in the NW

    20 November 2012 - The Department of Environmental Affairs has noted with concern and condemns the rhino killings witnessed in the North West province this past weekend. The savage and barbaric attack saw a total of seven rhinos killed at a game farm...Read more >>

Do you have a group aleady doing good green stuff? If you have - use A Better Africa to build, mobilise, and engage better.

New FTFA Ambassador Mbali Vilakazi Inspires

Mbali Vilakazi is an award-winning poet, performer and radio producer. Her practice is inspired and informed by the idea of “the personal as political” and “the body as intervention”. As both witness and participant, Mbali works to render visible the most invisible part of our conversations, our communities and our humanity.
